intro: Chamissoa brownii, commonly known as the Brown's chamissoa, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring. Chamissoa brownii is often found in open habitats such as hillsides and disturbed areas.
